Multiple instances of public posts and s: including the Conservative Party of Canada (CPC) leader Andrew Scheer and CPC representative Candice Malcom, spreading the news about the supposed tax on home sales.
The existence of a real document: which is a report on consultations on housing policy drafted in November 2018 by the Ontario caucus of the Liberal Party of Canada (LPC).
Confirmation from Liberal MP Adam Vaugha: who presented the report, that the proposal for a capital gains tax on the sale of primary residences is not a recommendation, policy proposal, or idea supported by him or the LPC.
The inclusion of the First: Time Home Buyer Incentive and the raised withdrawal limit from Registered Retirement Savings Plans in the current housing policy of the Liberal Party, which contradicts the claim of a proposed tax on home sales.
